title: Plumbing company fined for illegal advertising
text:
Plumbing company fined for illegal advertising 
Monday 27 Jul 2015 1:18 p.m. 
By 3 News online staff 
A warning's gone out to homeowners after an Auckland plumbing company was fined for advertising its services illegally. 
Jody Carden, director of No Limit Plumbing Ltd, was fined $4500 for advertising his services on Facebook and his company's website despite not being authorised to carry out sanitary plumbing work by the Plumbers, Gasfitters and Drainlayers Board (PGDB). 
Carden had earlier pleaded guilty to two charges of claiming to be licensed or registered and was convicted and fined in the Manukau District Court on Friday. 
PGDB's chief executive Martin Sawyers has reminded homeowners if they've had work done on their home by someone who isn't authorised or have concerns about the competency of tradespeople, they can make a complaint to the board. 
He says there are serious health and safety risks with work carried out by an unauthorised person. 
"Advertising may suggest a tradesperson is legitimate, when in fact they are not. 
"Don't risk your familyâ€™s health and safety or your insurance by hiring unauthorised people," Mr Sawyers says. 
Authorised tradespeople are required to carry their current authorisation card, and the public can help protect themselves by asking to see it. 
The board is a statutory body which regulates the industry trades. 
3 News
